results.content:
I love the instructor, but when I asked a question I never got a response. That's fine by me. I found my answers by digging deeper. So no hard feelings there. 
But my course gets stuck all the time. Initially, I thought it's my internet problem so I completely moved to a different ISP and still the problem persists. So I would ask UDEMY to fix this problem or give me a course on complete REACT. If I dont get a response then probably am never gonna purchase UDEMY course because your platform is not upto the mark
results.content_html:

results.content:
Positive:
Excellent in many ways: good pace, good explanation, good balance between theory and practice, good structure of course, good buildup from easy to complex.
Negative:
Some annoyances: repeating "as you can see" constantly, sound quality fluctuates, starting music in ReactJS section deafening
results.content_html:
Positive:
Excellent in many ways: good pace, good explanation, good balance between theory and practice, good structure of course, good buildup from easy to complex.
Negative:
Some annoyances: repeating "as you can see" constantly, sound quality fluctuates, starting music in ReactJS section deafening

results.content: The course was good, but for the react js practice problem the urls were not given - amazon one's. ANd there is an issue with the heat beat i tag while toggling which is not addressed. For an over all front end web development 101 this is a good course.
results.content_html: The course was good, but for the react js practice problem the urls were not given - amazon one's. ANd there is an issue with the heat beat i tag while toggling which is not addressed. For an over all front end web development 101 this is a good course.

results.content:
1) The course title is:

"React JS-Complete Guide"

The author then spends 95% of the time going over HTML, CSS and JavaScript basics.

2) The structure of the content makes it often-times hard to follow. I am trying to go through the HTML section as a refresher and find I get more from just doing the work myself, and checking what he did against what I did. The actual course material is nearly non-existent.
results.content_html:
1) The course title is:

"React JS-Complete Guide"

The author then spends 95% of the time going over HTML, CSS and JavaScript basics.

2) The structure of the content makes it often-times hard to follow. I am trying to go through the HTML section as a refresher and find I get more from just doing the work myself, and checking what he did against what I did. The actual course material is nearly non-existent.

results.content: I am working on an Associates degree in Computer Science and am using Udemy courses to provide specific skills that have only  been lightly covered in my college program.  What I really like so far about his course is that it does start you at the beginning of web development with HTML and CSS, which I have learned in school and on the job, but it fills in gaps in my learning.  I believe by the end of this course that I will be a better web developer with strengthened HTML, CSS and JavaScript skills.  In addition, adding the React library/framework will be a great addition to my toolbox.
results.content_html: I am working on an Associates degree in Computer Science and am using Udemy courses to provide specific skills that have only been lightly covered in my college program. What I really like so far about his course is that it does start you at the beginning of web development with HTML and CSS, which I have learned in school and on the job, but it fills in gaps in my learning. I believe by the end of this course that I will be a better web developer with strengthened HTML, CSS and JavaScript skills. In addition, adding the React library/framework will be a great addition to my toolbox.
